Articles.Content: I am new to modeling and for my first project i want to reuse the large science module for something and i need to know how to create and activate button can someone please help me. The part needs to be toggled so it won't consume all my resources (plasma).

You will probably find most help in the 'modding' forum: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/37-Add-on-Development - which deals with making mods for KSP.

'Modelling' usually refers to 3D-modelling - that is, making new parts, so I'm not sure if you mean that. If you do, the sub-forum of the above most appropriate would probably be:http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/14-Modelling-and-Texturing-Discussion

Note that creating mods is a programming task and that skill, or at least familiarity, with C# is almost a first requirement.

What I really want is a much easier way to change textures. The main problem is getting hold of the default texures in the first place!

I've used universe replacer and it is a good tool but I really wish there was some way to go back to the old .png images that you could just open and change...

Yes i am trying to make my own parts but i am new to 3d modeling and i use wings3d i thought i should start simple (ok REALLY REALLY simple)

If you're new to modelling then I'd recommend Blender instead, mostly because a lot of people here use it and will be able to help you more effectively.

Secondly don't just storm in here thinking you'll be making parts with buttons when you're a complete beginner. Look at my Skylon thread. It was my first, but because it's such a complex task I've had to put it on the back burner, while I do simpler things. Modding is a learning process, so if you don't enjoy learning, you might as well just give up now.
